availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Kentucky
Clark County Court
July 9th 1864

Whereas, Less than one year of the Term of Samuel G Stuart as Sheriff of Clark County Kentucky, remained unexpired at the time of his resignation of Said Office on Tuesday the 5th day of July 1864, on which date Said resignation was accepted, and the office of Sheriff of Said county declared vacant by the order of this court then made.

And the court having in accordance with the order of adjournments convened on this day to fill Said vacancy, and being advised, It is ordered that Jesse T Williams be appointed Sheriff of Clark County in place of, and for the unexpired term of Said Samuel G Stuart resigned.
And the same is ordered to be certified to his Excellency the Governor of this Commonwealth

A copy from the Record
Attest
Theodore Kohlhass clk
Clark County Court

Clarke Co
Shff
apptd
Recd
11th July/64
Comd
12th July/64
